intro: Anisopus batesii, commonly known as the narrowleaf anisopus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its blooming period occurs in the spring, producing white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anisopus batesii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
